quotes: Leuthard was a member of the Swiss National Council from 1999 to 2006 for the canton of Aargau.
She presided over the Christian Democratic People's Party from 2004 to 2006.
Leuthard was elected as his successor on 14 June 2006.
From 1 August 2006 until 31 October 2010, she was head of the Federal Department of Economic Affairs.
On 1 November 2010 she became head of the Federal Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications.
For the calendar year 2009, Leuthard was elected Vice President of the Swiss Confederation.
For the calendar year 2010.
She was elected President of the Confederation for 2010 and 2017.
She was succeeded by Calmy-Rey in 2011.
Following a reshuffle of portfolios after the by-election of two new Federal Councillors in 2010.

organizations.name: Federal Council
quotes: Due to a large amount of turnover on the Federal Council in recent years, she was the longest-serving Federal Councillor not to have served as the body's president.

roles.title: head of state
quotes: As President of the Confederation, Leuthard presided over meetings of the Federal Council and carried out representative functions that would normally be handled by a head of state in other democracies.

roles.title: primus inter pares
quotes: However, in most cases, Leuthard was merely primus inter pares, with no power above and beyond her six colleagues.
